It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are elongated and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually unbranched. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Erythrocephalum longifolium is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils.
